newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish shares end lower after lacklustre day.
newsitem.headline: Swedish shares end lower after lacklustre day.

text.p: 1500 GMT - Swedish shares closed lower across the board on Wednesday after a day of lacklustre trade with no direction at home or from weak overseas markets. * Stockholm general index falls 0.4 percent to 2,890.16 * Turnover 4.34 billion crowns * Pharmacia & Upjohn falls 6.5 to 258.5 crowns on renewed market rumours of a profit warnings. The company denied there were any such plans. Broker Aros cuts its trading recommendation to reduce from accumulate after a company visit. * Bluechips mixed. Telecoms group Ericsson rises one to 297 crowns while drugs company Astra dips one to 130 crowns.
Swedish shares closed lower across the board on Wednesday after a day of lacklustre trade with no direction at home or from weak overseas markets.
The Stockholm general index fell 0.4 percent to 2,890.16 in average turnover of 4.34 billion crowns.
Brokers expected the market to remain quiet on Thursday with many players leaving early to enjoy the long midsummer weekend. The bourse is closed on Friday.
The biggest mover of the day was U.S./Swedish drugs compay Pharmacia & Upjohn which ended 6.5 crowns lower at 258.5 but was trading as low as 252 crowns during the day.
Brokers said the share was hit by renewed rumours of a profit warning, Brokerage Aros cuts its trading recommendation to reduce from accumulate after a company visit.
The company denied any such plans. "There is no truth behind talk of a profit warning," a company spokesman said.
Bluechip stocks were mixed. Telecoms group Ericsson edged up one crown to 297 while drugs major Astra dipped one to 130 crowns.
Fashion retailer Hennes & Mauritz fell eight to 274 crowns after rising on better-than-expected half year earnings earlier this week. -- Stockholm newsroom +46-8-700 1017
